title: Xiongnu
summary: The Xiongnu (Chinese: 匈奴; pinyin: Xiōngnú,[3] [ɕjʊ́ŋ.nǔ]) were a tribal confederation[4] of nomadic peoples who, according to ancient Chinese sources, inhabited the eastern Eurasian Steppe from the 3rd century BC to the late 1st century AD. Chinese sources report that Modu Chanyu, the supreme leader after 209 BC, founded the Xiongnu Empire.[5]
